sources.title: The Stalking Moon (1968) Gregory Peck · Eva Marie Saint
sources.description: In 1881, a brave army mercenary offers a woman and her Native American son protection from the child's vengeful father until he is killed in a duel.   A film that strives to continue Hollywood's Western tradition, where tension and fascination are not superficially created, but rather arise from an inner human conflict.

metadata.Plot: When an army scout retires to a farm in New Mexico he takes pity on a white woman and her "half-breed" son recently rescued from Indians, and invites them to join him. He does this even knowing the child's father is a feared and murderous Apache and that sooner or later a showdown is almost inevitable.
metadata.Writer: Alvin Sargent, Wendell Mayes, Theodore V. Olsen
metadata.Actors: Gregory Peck, Eva Marie Saint, Robert Forster
